body:
### Problem

I've created a issue in nvin-treesitter about this bug. According to this response, reproduced the error.

I think this is an issue with neovim core, stemming from the fact that a buffer is given the treesitter foldexpr, then the filetype changes (to one without a parser, i.e. no fold queries), then buffer content changes (now there is no way to properly calculate folds, because no parser/fold queries); hence an error

_Originally posted by @ribru17 in https://github.com/nvim-treesitter/nvim-treesitter/issues/6822#issuecomment-2196072409_

### Steps to reproduce

1. Visit a file, say some test.cpp with treesitter actived
2. On command line, exec `set ft=xxd`
3. On command line, exec `%!xxd`, there would be an error msg like "no parser for 'xxd' language"

### Expected behavior

No treesitter parser actived by this situation

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

0.10.0

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

no

### Operating system/version

ubuntu 22.04

### Terminal name/version

xterm

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256

### Installation

appimage

comment_data.body: This is not enough to repro this; please provide exact steps using `nvim --clean`.

> This is not enough to repro this; please provide exact steps using `nvim --clean`.

Maybe it's not exactly clear. But without the plugin nvim-treesitter, I don't think there would be parser error here.

Sure; both the foldexpr and enough treesitter parsers are provided by Neovim itself. In any case (even if a plugin is needed), we require fully reproducible and minimal steps to investigate the problem and possible fixes ourselves.

OK, I can confirm without the plugin nvim-treesitter, there is no error msg for the procedure above.
So the minimal procedure is 
1. Start with nvim --clean
2. Enable the nvim-treesitter plugin
3. Visit a file, say some test.cpp to active treesitter
4. On command line, exec `set ft=xxd`
5. On command line, exec `%!xxd`, there would be an error msg like "no parser for 'xxd' language"

> Enable the nvim-treesitter plugin

This could mean so many things. Please, we need _concrete_, **reproducible** steps. This includes a minimal(!) config for `nvim --clean -u test.lua`. (Just to be clear, I cannot reproduce the issue with treesitter foldexpr.)

> > Enable the nvim-treesitter plugin
> 
> This could mean so many things. Please, we need _concrete_, **reproducible** steps. This includes a minimal(!) config for `nvim --clean -u test.lua`. (Just to be clear, I cannot reproduce the issue with treesitter foldexpr.)

I know what you mean.
However, I cannot produce this issue if 
`vim.treesitter.language.add('cpp', {path = '/path/to/cpp.so'})`
and
`vim.treesitter.start()`
was execute.
So there must be something else in the plugin api that invoke the xxd language parser. 
That's beyond what i can do.

Well, look at _your_ config and remove everything that is not needed to trigger the error (didn't you mention that folding is required?) Right now, there's nothing we can do without further information.
@ribru17 Any suggestions how to enable treesitter folding manually?
How are _you_ enabling it right now? It's not enabled automatically.
Then treesitter folding is not used, so I'm even more confused by this report.

> I've set fildmethod=syntax

I mean when I try to give a minimal procedure, I set the fdm to syntax
Please give a _full_ set of steps -- edit your initial description with a `test.lua` we can copy and run with `nvim --clean -u test.lua`.

In `contrib/minimal.lua` there's a template to get you started which you can use to download the plugins you may need. Use that with `nvim --clean -u minimal.lua` with as little code as possible to recreate the issue.

> Please give a _full_ set of steps -- edit your initial description with a `test.lua` we can copy and run with `nvim --clean -u test.lua`.

Thanks for your reply. I create a minimal config and did not produce the issue. I'll just close it now and make some deep invest.

Minimal init:

```lua
vim.bo.ft = 'lua'
vim.wo.foldmethod = 'expr'
vim.wo.foldexpr = 'v:lua.vim.treesitter.foldexpr()'

vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('BufEnter', {
  callback = function()
    vim.bo.ft = 'asdf'
    -- any text edit
    vim.cmd.normal('o')
  end,
})
```

Errors on any file edits:
```
Error executing vim.schedule lua callback: ...Projects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/language.lua:107: no parser for 'asdf' language, see :help treesitter-parsers                                                                                                                           
stack traceback:                                                                                                                                 
        [C]: in function 'error'                                                                                                                 
        ...Projects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/language.lua:107: in function 'add'                                                       
        ...ects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/languagetree.lua:111: in function 'new'                                                       
        ...ents/CodeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter.lua:41: in function '_create_parser'                                             
        ...ents/CodeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter.lua:108: in function 'get_parser'                                                
        ...odeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:117: in function 'compute_folds_levels'                                      
        ...odeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:380: in function 'fn'                                                        
        ...odeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:293: in function <...odeProjects/neovim/runtime//lua/vim/treesitter/_fold.lua:289>
```

I think a fix is needed in both Nvim core and and nvim-treesitter:
- In Nvim core, there need to be a way to detach a parser from a buffer (`vim.treesitter.stop()` currently only disables highlighting and doesn't detach the parser).
- In Nvim core, for filetypes that enable treesitter by default, `b:undo_ftplugin` should detach the parser.
- In nvim-treesitter, a parser should be detached when filetype changes.

> In nvim-treesitter, a parser should be detached when filetype changes.

Nvim-treesitter does (will) not handle anything parser-related (beyond (un)installing), so no change is needed there.
Oh, nvim-treesitter already calls `vim.treesitter.stop()`. Then it doesn't need change.

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: Unexpected active treesitter parser (vim.treesitter.stop() doesn't detach parser)
